Description: Narrow foot and body sherd of East Greek grey ware pottery alabastron or aryballos; light grey fabric with large quantity of mica; very worn and very dark slip on exterior; shallow groove preserved at top of sherd.
Curator's comments: The fragment looks as though it belongs to 1888,0601.640b, but a join cannot be made. It is not impossible that it belongs to an aryballos, though a footed alabastron seems more probable. Compare examples from Catania, A. Pautasso, Stipe votiva del santuario di Demetra a Catania; la ceramica greco-orientale (Catania, 2009), 29, fig. 4, 50-51 and pl. II, 50-51.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.025)
